Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The first step is to analyze the event log for CaseID A1 to identify recurring sequences and logical connections between events. I can see a clear temporal order. The activities for Case A1 and Case B2 follow the same sequence, indicating a standardized process.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: I will hypothesize logical groupings based on semantics, resources, and temporal proximity. The initial events (Retrieve, Scan, Place, Align, Preheat) all seem to serve the purpose of preparation. They occur in a tight time window at the very beginning.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: A second group appears around the welding activities. Pick up welding tool, Weld corner A, and Weld corner B are all performed by Operator B and constitute the core assembly task.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: The remaining events (Measure weld integrity, Apply protective coating, Dry coating, Visual check) seem to form a final finishing and checking phase. They occur after the main assembly is complete.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: From these hypotheses, I can deduce a three-stage process model. Stage 1 is Material Preparation, Stage 2 is Assembly, and Stage 3 is Finishing and Inspection. This model simplifies the dozen low-level events into three understandable phases, which aligns with the goal of the task.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: I will now check this model against the data for CaseID B2. The sequence of activities is identical, which validates that this three-stage grouping is a consistent and accurate representation of the manufacturing workflow.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Now, I will formalize this into the required output format, providing a clear name, a list of included events, and a justification for each high-level step.
